title: Brilliant service
body:
I went with a worrying problem but could not be classed as an emergency.
They were so understanding and kind.
Such efficient treatment, including follow up appointments.
I cannot praise everyone there highly enough.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly service
body: I had a telephone consultation with the gp he was very friendly and gave me some good advice which I have followed definitely would recommend this service to friends and family

title: Great as always
body:
Used the e-consult and had a phone call within two days, appointment with my Dr within 4 days. 
The appointment was only in 4 days, because I prefer to see ‘my’ Dr., otherwise it would’ve been made sooner. 

In all this chaos and criticism, I felt I had to leave a Thank You (couldn’t use capitals) to all the staff for listening, supporting and understanding.
Thank you
Theresa Leonhardt

title: Great Staff
body: I don't normally have reason to visit my GP but I have had a recent health scare and have to give credit where it's due, all the staff at the surgery have been amazing. Really understanding and actually care. Thank you all so much :)

title: Well done everyone at Fakenham Medical Practice
body: My wife & I came for our Covid booster and Flu vaccination on Thursday evening. I know you had a lot of trouble on Saturday but you have managed to get on top of the problems (which were not of your making anyway). Our sincere thanks to all the volunteers, nurses and doctors. We feel we are really fortunate to have such a wonderful team working on our behalf. I don't think anyone could have done better and you are a credit to the NHS.

title: Understanding doctor
body: I had a phone call for my menopause issue and he was fantasticly understanding and helpful,he explained everything and also listened to me,he was not patronising and we also had a laugh. Thank you.

title: PIU day clinic
body: Wow what an outstanding department. Friendly and efficient and well managed. This is a department that should be held up as a great example of how a department can run. The planned intervention unit administers my intravenous biomedical medicine that is currently making life easier, I have active Crohn’s disease and Ulcerative Colitis, the department make me welcome and the infusion is given with loads of professional attention and care. 5* star NHS LGBTQ friendly staff.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpful and friendly
body: The girls on reception are always really helpfull and kind, the doctors are great and don't normally have to wait ages for an appointment.

title: Nurse practitioner
body: She is really professional, supportive and knowledgeable. Makes you feel very at ease, and do not feel rushed.

title: Fantastic Doctor
body:
My client was at hospital, and the Dr who cared for her was fantastic! (Dr Fell)
He was caring, kind, thorough, and understanding!

title: Amazing experience
body: I made to be very welcome and very looked after the staff couldn't do enough for me to make my stay the most comfortable it could be! All very friendly, kind and caring! Thank you for looking after on ward 5b!!

title: New telephone system
body: I have mostly dealt with nurse practitioner and have been very happy with my experience and treatment.  The new system appears much improved with updates on position in queue - my recent call was a very quick turnaround - and if the queue is long there is now an option to reserve your place and get a callback when you are next in line so no more sitting and waiting on the phone.  Very happy with the changes.

title: Reception
body: The receptionist was very kind and friendly which made the experience so much more pleasant.  I also received a phone call from the doctor who really took the time to listen.  Very positive experience.

title: fantastic support
body: was treated with fantastic support by all the staff, very helpful, and understanding, and very caring. thank you all.

title: Excellent practice
body: I’ve been a patient here since it opened, never ever had any problems in all them years. Reception staff, nurses, physiotherapist, doctors,  making appointments, medications requests, etc etc.

title: It is all about the staff
body:
I had a consultation in the joint gynae/colorectal surgical service to plan my surgery. Each member of the Team I met at that consultation was professional, knowledgeable, helpful and reassuring.
I had my surgery on the date I was given with no delays, and no changes.  Everyone did what I was told they would do, from the stoma nurse who I met in the pre-op room (but didn't need her services again), to the anaesthetist , the gynae surgeon who came from the Liverpool Women's Hospital to do his part of the procedure, the local surgeon from the colorectal service and Registrar who did the rest of my mammoth operation and fed back to me in HDU, to every member of nursing staff (and IV Team) who looked after me in HDU, and especially on Ward 4 during my stay I owe a debt of gratitude. I cannot thank them enough for their care, concern and encouragement. They are a great team providing an invaluable service, and should be acknowledged as such.  Thank you.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: High standards of professionalism delivered…
body: We entered AnE in a very stressed state. From the receptionist onwards, every member of staff we met showed us excellent care and consideration. The AnE area and later Zone C were spotless and well equipped.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient, wonderful service
body: I called and requested a call back, call handler was extremely friendly and helpful, thank you. Duty doctor called back later that day and was efficient and caring. Collected script from pharmacy later that afternoon. Thank you. Thus surgery is run very very well.

title: Good staff
body: Having a nose bleed for nearly  two weeks .it was great to get appointment  though my doctor to the Freeman hospital  to the ent department .and my problem  sorted

title: Good Practice
body: They all seem to work together making you feel comfortable particularly  the old and young . If you are feeling down they will cheer you up..I cannot really mention treatment but after being one of their patients for over 67 years i can say I have been well looked after.

title: Amazing members of staff.
body:
After having bleeding occur during my pregnancy, being constantly sick throughout, I ended up on Frank Shaw ward over the last couple of days. 
I honestly couldn't have had a better experience here. After spending 2 hours at A&E at another hospital, to be told they don't have a midwifery department... We drove to Conquest Hospital, went to the A&E department, they could not have been more helpful after realising what I had already been through-  made sure I could go down to the midwifery department with no fuss. Despite the fact this was very early hours of the morning at this point, they made me feel so comfortable, although I was visibly distressed. 
I was then monitored quickly, given all the appropriate tests, got to hear our baby's heartbeat and felt so reassured. 

I have then spent today on Frank Shaw ward and had the most wonderful members of staff take great care of me. They even made my partner feel really comfortable here. They were so friendly and encouraging, especially after they realised just how dehydrated I was. Thankfully I am fine now, baby is all fine and I got to go home.

Unfortunately, I won't get to see them again as I am under a different hospital generally for my prenatal care, but even that didn't stop them doing an amazing job. 

It's a shame I cannot mention them by name, because they honestly deserve all the praise. 

Thank you so much everyone.

title: Useless booking desks
body: Came 15 mins before my appointment, booked in at first desk at the entrance with my name, etc and was told everything is ok and sent to waiting area. Just in case asked at 2nd booking desk if need to check in again, was told no, just take a seat. What happend I missed my scan slot and clinic consultation cause ladies from booking desks didn't book me in. Waited 2.5h, being 30 weeks pregnant and diabetic.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Hostile Policies
body:
Requested a letter from the doctor to help with a benefits claim. Patient summaries/print-outs don't help with these types of situations. My previous surgery had more patients and fewer staff and didn't charge patients for letters.

The surgery charges an obscene £25 for a simple paragraph of text. The surgery says that they have to charge because it's not NHS work and 'practice policy'.

They didn't discuss costs before agreeing to it. Now the letter is written and the time and effort has been spent, but they won't provide it unless I pay their surprise charge. Essentially, their time and effort has gone to waste.

As someone who is unemployed because of my disability, I cannot afford such exorbitant fees.

title: Coved Vaccination Centre
body: Both reception and nursing staff, could not be faulted, they were very professional, helpful and friendly. The only problem experienced was the absence of any signage to, or on the buildings, making it particularly difficult for those with disabilities.

title: The Best
body: I am leaving this review for my wife, she was an extremely nervous patient. but after the initial assessment and the actual Operation a few weeks later. she was very anxious she came out just over an hour later. and was singing spa medicas praises. The Chelmsford team were absolutely professional and courteous from start to finish. she said to me afterwards that all the worry was for nothing.  she is so happy with the outcome and her sight is so much better after just a couple of days.  Thank You Spa Medica.

title: Excellent vaccination arrangements
body: Very well arranged flu and Covid jabs for a large number of people and in good time for Autumn/Winter

title: Dangerous practice Avoid
body: Avoid this practice like the plague!! My father is on end of life care and requires weekly blister packs. For the past two weeks the doctors have not signed his prescription on time and he has been left with no medication. The pharmacists have spoken to the surgery explaining how the prescription needs signing, yet they still haven’t signed it in time. I have requested to speak to the practice manager but conveniently ‘they were not available’. The surgery have refused to asked the doctor to sign the prescription as they have 48hours to do it, even though this means my dad does not have medication for Monday. We have rang the pharmacist for a prescription, but due to the medication he requires they can’t give us one. This is not the first time we have had issues, and it is down to the surgery’s lack of professionalism, duty of care and delay in opening the surgery post Covid (even though told to by the government) that my father is in the situation he is in now. Please Please avoid this practice, they are dangerous and should not be open, they are not safe.

title: Outstanding service
body: The GP went above and beyond to make sure my daughters care and needs was seen to and met. They even contacted the school to liaise with the teachers in regards to her health. This is very impressive as GP’s are very busy and didn’t have to do this. I’m very satisfied with the outcome.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: On almost every occasion I have tried to get an appointment all I can access is a message which tells me the doctors have gone past their capacity and I should call another day.

title: Rubbish reception team.
body:
When ever trying to get through to GP the reception team is very unwilling to help and acts like they know everything. Getting mixed information from them. Last 3 times or so when trying to get through to my GP no luck. Have to organise everything through specialist treatment units like they nothing better to do then pick up the slack of some people who think they know best and are always right.
No complaints to my GP. Always been helpful when Abel to contact.

title: Caring and considerate
body: I have been registered at Mark Street surgery for the past 28 years and feel the service provided to me when needed is excellent. The GPs have the time to listen and explain things to you in simple terms. I have never felt rushed at the surgery when seeing a GP or a nurse. The only reservations I have are over the past 2 years some of the  reception staff have gone worse, I feel they have no companion or empathy, they don't listen to you. I am the most calm person I know but feel that calmness disappear when I speak to some of the reception staff. I understand they are busy but they need to understand people contact the GP surgery for a reason and should listen and take on board what the customer is saying. Maybe those in question need to complete further training in customer services. I myself deal with customers on a daily basis and treat them the way I like to be treated. The reception is the first point of call and if patients are not treated in the right manner from the start unfortunately it will have a negative effect on the GP surgery.

title: Efficient surgery
body: Just had my flu jab very efficient very quick bit of confusion over where it would take place which for older patients could be distressing I had to ring surgery to check and was on hold for 15 minutes !

title: Great reception
body: The 3 ladies that work on the reception are very helpful and professional in what they do also the practice manager is also professional and approachable

title: Maternity Ward
body:
I cannot fault the maternity ward at Basildon hospital at all, they have been absolutely fantastic with 3 of my pregnancies now. 

In February 2022, I lost my daughter when I was 19 weeks pregnant as she had no heartbeat. Every midwife I met during the process was understanding and patient answering every question I had. The forget-me-not suite met all of my needs and everyone was considerate as they came in and left the room. 

I am now pregnant again and everyone is so understanding of my anxieties. The bereavement midwives have been absolutely fantastic making sure they are with me every step of the way and are always at the end of the phone to me. 

I feel that the maternity ward has received such a negative reputation but I have nothing but praise for all the staff.

title: Disappointing GP
body: For the past two years this GP has fallen apart. There are no consistent doctors who stay at the practice which as a patient you can not build any sort of relationship. In addition, you have to go through a very long online e-consultation form which can be answer up to 2 working days. When the doctor does respond back it’s from a phone call or a text message. There is no face to face communication what so ever. At times the doctors send out a web link from the internet which you can just access your self with information of the symptoms you are experiencing. The doctors who are at the GP are just newly qualified and how no experience towards the way they communicate with patience. There is always someone new at the receptionist and 90% of the time have no clue about things and give out wrong information. The practice as a whole has lost its value and trust from its patience’s who have been with this GP for years. I would not recommend this GP to anyone, it is so bad that I have now registered to a new GP.

title: Poor standard of care and compassion
body: Filled out an E-Consult on Tuesday, got a text message Friday saying I couldn’t be helped. Call the practice, bad attitude from reception, doctor refusing to speak to me and thought that a text message was sufficient help. Spoke to business support who were supposed to call me back and didn’t (shock) absolutely devastated I’ve ended up at this practice, will not be going back.

title: Flu Jab.
body: Everything about the organisation of the flu jab was excellent. I got my link via phone,booked a convenient time and turned up! The jab itself was over in a second and administered very professionally,as always.  In general,my engagements with Orchard Medical Centre,via phone,website or in person are always  professional, helpful and very satisfactory indeed. Five stars!

title: Excellent Flu Jab Service
body:
This system works extremely efficiently. The staff are helpful and reassuring. The whole process is very quick and pain free!
Many thanks.

title: Friendly, responsive and supportive practice!
body: All round great practice, from the prompt response when calling, to the friendly and helpful reception team, and the same day phone call following up on the email I sent. I do not recall the name of the GP I spoke to, but she was fabulous. She worked through every part of my email giving me detailed information and guidance. I then received a follow up call as promised from the Social Prescriber, who offered further support and shared useful information. Thank you!

title: Always cheerful
body: Annual flu injection with the Corfe Mullen branch. quick, cheerful. Queue management was friendly and professional.

title: Covid and Flu Jabs
body: We visited this morning for our covid booster and flu vaccinations.  Wonderfully helpful and professional staff, from marshals outside, to reception, and nurses delivering vaccinations.  Informative, thorough, friendly and quick.  Thank you Marazion Surgery.

title: Total Hip Replacement
body: I had this operation in 6th June 2022. The whole experience was amazing. I was looked after very well by the surgeon and the nursing staff. My room was lovely with my own private bathroom. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Beaumont to anyone. I have been given back my quality of life and am now pain free

title: Good Practice
body: Mostly have seen nursing staff at the practice they have always been approachable and good information given whdn required. Reception staff also approachable and helpful.

title: Well organised Flu Vaccination drive
body: To express thanks for a smooth, well organised visit this morning for a flu vaccination. Thank you to all of the staff.

title: no appointments, no doctors
body:
There are simply no appointments. You must rely on being the first four people in the queue which  means being there around 7am as after 4 appointments have been given, you will be told by the staff behind the desk that there are simply no other appointments for the day. They will also refuse to book you an appointment for the next day, claiming that they 'cannot access the schedule in advance'. You can queue whilst being on the phone at the same time for days on end. Only after managing to go on some unknown online booking system did we manage to get an appointment for our daughter. 
I have seen elderly people and heavily pregnant turned down at 8am after queueing for one hour.  
We have given up with our doctors and now have to use walk in centres if we require any medical treatment.

title: So Lovely.
body: This surgery, must be the highest regarded in Stratford. Wonderful GP's and nurses who go above and beyond.I have never felt hurried and have always felt that any medical problems are solved quickly. I have been impressed by the fact, that there is often a follow up message to check that all is well. Superb!

title: Good treatment
body:
I was taken by ambulance and sent to majors straight away. The staff introduced who was looking after me but with having chest pain other staff were concerned and took action making sure treatment was given. It did take a few hours to control my pain with pain relieve every two hours but they got it under control as a collection of staff. I had two sets of bloods taken and scans during my time without a definite diagnosis. I returned next day to SAU and had more bloods and scans but had to wait a long time for a surgeon to give a valuation of my diagnosis. He was right but I also have another problem that needs further investigation. Conclusion: the A&E staff were fantastic and the surgeons were correct in 
my diagnosis from the evidence they had.

title: Very Impressed
body: Been for a flu vaccination  this morning at my local Health Centre Rainworth Surgery, I was very impressed with the efficiency, both at the book in desk and whilst receiving the vaccine, I would definitely recommend. They have a very well organised system.

title: Appreciation
body: Just been to Rawnsley surgery  for my flu vaccine.A huge Thankyou to all Rawnsley staff for giving their Saturday up. Much appreciated.  Alway highly recommend 👌

title: No appointments
body: You cannot get an appointment at this surgery for any acute problem, or for anything that can wait. There are never any appointments on-line, and when you phone, if you are able to get through in less than an hour, there are never any appointments available. There is one receptionist who is very nice, but one is very unhelpful. If you can use e-consult then that works, but if you have a query, or ongoing problem, then forget it. I think I am going to change practices, which is a shame because when you eventually get to see a Doctor, they are very helpfull.

title: Anti disabled.outside lift not fit for purpose,…
body: The previous lift up to the entrance hardly ever worked but now a new one is installed it has Never, ever worked. So much for equality of care and adequately meeting the requirements of the disabled

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Excellent care
body: Had a hernia repair op 30th September,all the Nurses and staff were fantastic,as were the surgical team,Thank you all!!

title: Fantastic service and organisation
body: Visited for COVID 19 booster. Best experience. Meticulous planning and organisation, executed by professional and empathetic staff.Well done to all involved. Thank you

title: Can’t get attention to the vulnerable
body:
My mum is 67 y.o. Post-cancer and post-stroke. Just arrived from the war zone. We’ve been trying to schedule general assessment with her since 3 days and instead are offered a phone call at the time suitable to GP anytime during 24 hours, which means shall we miss it - it’s our problem.
I work 12 hours a day and pay tax to NHS to help them with them cost, hardly use the service for myself, as I’m always not I’ll enough. But such a poor treatment to the vulnerable one from the Florence Road Surgery staff is even more disappointing.

title: Triage
body:
I am appalled that my 8 week old granddaughter  (6/52 premature) mother phones to request. Appointment or Dr call back 
45 minute wait to be informed by receptionist No appointments  call 111  asked again re enforcing babies age and unwell same response 
However 111 called and they called surgery 
Dr called back and offered appointment that afternoon 


Call 111 .

title: Great practice, great staff 100%
body: I have recently had cataracts removed from both eyes at Oldham practice and can't praise it enough. From being welcomed at the door to receptionists, interviewers, nurses, optometrists and surgeons, everyone was pleasant, efficient, informative and very helpful. I could not have been treated better if I had paid privately for the treatment. Most of all the cataract surgery was extremely successful, everything looks so much brighter, clearer and high definition technicolour. Thank you to everyone at SpaMedica Oldham.

title: No way to contact surgery
body:
I find it impossible as someone who works full time, to make appointments for routine screens or just to get hold of this surgery in general. The phone system is continually full and they ask you not to phone but to use the online system. I would much prefer to use the online system as this is easier if I'm working. But the surgery close the online system from 3pm each day and it stays closed until opening the following day. It's also closed at the weekend. What's the point of an online system you can't use out of hours. After finally finding a time in my working day where I was able to complete the online form, 5 days later I still haven't had a reply so I still haven't been able to make my appointment for my screening that I need. I have since tried ringing but after waiting 15 minutes and still being told I was 12 in the queue I was unable to stay on the phone any longer (I was at work).
 Their phone system tells you if it's not urgent there's a delay of 4 weeks for them to be able to accept routine requests, which again, is not helpful if a patient is unsure how serious something could be.
 This is completely unacceptable, patients cannot ask questions, request medications or make appointments. Requests are not followed up, results are not sent out so you have to go through the painful process of trying to contact the surgery for your results all over again. This surgery is not meeting the needs of it's patients.

title: Vaccination frenzy!
body:
Total chaos at the flu vaccination at Broomfield this morning. People everywhere like a football stadium, nowhere to park, cars queuing out to the main road. Could have done with someone to direct traffic.
I had to repeat my name to the receptionists at least 3 times before she got it, and she didn't understand the ethnicity question - what happens the patient doesn't fit neatly into one of the boxes - ( middle eastern) please do some training on this

title: Great practice
body: Very pleased with the staff and doctors professionalism and dedication to patients with vaccination services and all aspects of health in the past 40 years.

title: Fab practice
body: I’ve been here for over 10yrs an can not fault the practice at all.from walking through door an back out.Every member of the team are respectful happy,helpful, thorough.I’ve never had an issue getting an appointment, nothing has ever been too much trouble,by far the best practice I have ever been with.if privacy has been needed when talking to reception team, it has been provided without questions, preferred choice of dr/nurse has always been granted where possible.I have seen and heard a lot of negativity about this practice,Maybe if patients treated the staff with a little bit of respect an talked to them nicely,rather then been quite so demanding an abusive and rude, has I have witnessed over the years and staff have remained polite calm and professional an done their best with difficult patients.They would find a first class service is what you actually get at this practice.

title: Flu Clinic
body: Just been for my 2022 Flu jab at Corfe Hills School and can only say how extremely well organised and efficient the process was

title: Waste of time
body: Put a repeat prescription in on 27/9/22 via the app, rang on 30/9/22 as no prescription yet, told would be done within the next few hours. Still no prescription and now out of medication. This is not the first time either. Very frustrating and poorly run

title: Efficient
body: I was amazed but disappointed at the huge number of 'patients' who arrived for their annual Flu jab at Corfe Hills school. I needn't have worried. Diligent marshalling kept the queue moving and I was attended to efficiently and on time. Very well organised

title: Excellent GP Practice
body: I attended the Flu Clinic at Corfe Hills School on Saturday 1 October 2022.  The clinic was efficiently run and I received my flu vaccination in a timely fashion.  Thank you.

title: Great practice
body: Went for my flu jab. Very friendly staff. The doctor who gave me my flu Jab was very professional &  friendly.  I have been with this practice for over 30 years. Thank you so much.

title: Superb practice
body: Very kind and compassionate Doctors, nurses, admin and reception team. They listen intently to my problems and discuss solutions that I can handle.

title: Great Experience at Orchard
body: this practice has been one of the best in my last 7 years in uk. Whether it's for an appointment or a referral they have been really quick and cooperative. Would recommend anyone to come here

title: Inguinal Hernia Repair
body:
I had a very successful vist to Rake Lane Day Surgery yesterday. 
I would highly recommend everyone involved, surgeons  anesthetists and nursing and theatre staff. 
They made what can often be an anxious time very bearable. 
A very big Thank You to everyone !

title: Great Practice to go to
body: Staff are polite, Doctors are caring, take time to understand issues. Oractice offers car parking, receive reminders for vaccination/appts. Overall super!

title: Excellent organisation
body: I attended the surgery this morning for my COVID and flu jabs. The set up was extremely well organised, friendly and efficient. I did not have to wait at all.

title: Well Organised and Efficient
body: Excellent organisation and quick. Surgery operated a one system which worked well. Senior doctors on hand as well

title: Great practice
body: Very efficient and helpful most recent visit was a nice experience the nurse was very good and most respectfull

title: Above and beyond
body: I wanted to express our great thanks and appreciation for your reception staff, nurse and assistant who went above and beyond to help my mum with her vaccine this morning, your flexibility in doing the jab in the car meant so much as she was really struggling with her mobility today. We cannot thank you enough and really appreciate what you did for us.

title: Outstanding  Flu Jab Service
body: Truly amazed & delighted at the efficiency how quickly I receives my flu jab. Was like on a conveyor belt in and out in seconds. I have said before I wish I'd left my previous ,epically centre ages ago and come to this one.

title: Flu jab
body: Brilliantly organised, went like clockwork. Less than 5 mins from arrival during allocated time slot, check in, brief queue, jab (virtually painless), and out.

title: Fabulous staff
body:
I was happy with every aspect of the service. There was clear communication before and during my appointment and everything was explained in depth. 

Staff was very friendly, which made me feel a lot more comfortable and there was support at every step of the process.

title: Excellent practice
body:
The flu and Covid vacation clinic today was very well organised 
And a very friendly atmosphere.with no waiting and the fire station is an ideal building for this.

title: Friendly staff
body: All staff are friendly and helpful and try hard to provide a good service. Chemist next door which is very handy

title: Great practice, great treatment
body: Really pleased how quickly I was referred to hospital.  I know a lot of people still can't get a GP appointment but I had no trouble.

title: Faultless
body:
I had to rely on a transport service that, unfortunately, arrived late for my second op. at Tetbury. In spite of that, the cataract department treated me very generously and made sure I was given my surgery promptly.
The nursing staff was thorough, very personable, and caring. The surgeon was reassuring and positive throughout. I would recommend this department without hesitation.

title: Great work Keloid treatment
body: I think she done a great because I feel more confident with my skin again, the scratch is less job however I think the job is not end even if only I have the right for 3 session. For me is not ethic but I respect the decision. Thanks indeed

title: The staff were extremely helpful
body: Many people feel that they must see a Doctor. My consultation with practice nurse who then referred me to the nurse practitioner were both extremely helpful .

title: Flu jab
body:
Extremely efficient and well organised 
Everyone very helpful 
Good experience … not sure what else I can say

title: Flu jab
body:
Extremely efficient and well organised 
Everyone very helpful 
Good experience … not sure what else I can say

title: Great Practice
body: The flu vaccine was administered very effectively. The booking service worked well, reminders were sent, and the organisation on the day was very good.

title: Great practice
body: Efficient and professional staff with a friendly welcome. We would highly recommend this practice and the health services they provide.

title: Great service for Flu & Coronavirus Jabs
body: I went this morning to get my flu and coronavirus jabs and just wanted to say what a great job all the staff were doing. From the stewards in the car park to the nurses and medical staff I want to say thank you. You gave a very efficient and well organised service.

title: Flu jab
body:
Extremely efficient and well organised 
Everyone very helpful 
Good experience … not sure what else I can say

title: Flu clinic
body:
Today I attended the annual Flu Clinic from The Hadleigh Practice and it was very well organised, the queue seemed long, but I was in and out in 5 minutes! 
Excellent job Hadleigh Practice team :-)

title: Absolutely amazing care at the Endoscopy Unit
body: I attended the Endoscopy Unit today for both a Gastroscopy and Colonoscopy. Every single step of my patient journey was incredibly well managed. The efficient and very helpful booking process was a great start and the preparatory materials sent to me were clear and well put together. On arrival, the Unit looked clean, professional and appeared to be very organised. I was greeted by a lovely welcoming staff member and then cared for by the most personable, caring and attentive nursing staff before, during and after my procedures. The Consultant was very personable and incredibly thorough, much more so than I have experienced with similar examinations at other Trusts. People living in Harrogate need to understand just how lucky they are to have such a wonderful service on their doorstep. Overall, an outstanding level of care and (even though it's a far from pleasant procedure to have to endure from a patient perspective) a delightful patient experience. Well done.

title: Great experience
body:
Extremely professional always friendly wirh welcoming smile.
Always seen within mins of appointment time  
If I have concerns they're always ready to listen 
Most important since the days of having our own family doctor whom knew us well I feel confident pathfields has filled this gap with they're well established systems they have put in place .

title: Flu Clinic
body: Excellently and efficiently organised at local school again. Very quick in and out! Well staffed and didn't feel a thing :)

title: Professional excellence
body: My wife and I have always been impressed with the total professionalism of your practice and today for our flu/covid jab  was no exception. Thank you for making it a pleasant experience.

title: Excellent Team
body: Visited the Surgery for my Flu jab and the reception team were very courteous and friendly and made one feel relaxed.

title: Great practice
body: Very quick and efficient service to get my flu jab completed within three days of booking an appointment

title: Great flu service
body: The staff were Very friendly and the service was very well organised, quick, prompt and a professional service. If only all appointments ran like this.

title: Great service and care at my GP practice
body: I found the whole experience extremely well organised. From booking my appointment online to receiving the vaccination at the clinic everything went without a hitch. The staff members at the clinic were very friendly people, I was in and out with no fuss at all, well done and thank you everyone.

title: Flu clinic
body: Thank you for such a great flu clinic: quick, easy, all staff very friendly. Nicely done! A very good surgery . Thank you all for your hard work.

title: Outstanding practice
body:
The reception staff are always helpful, friendly and understanding, I always feel they do their best for me.
The medical staff are brilliant. There is no doubt they go the extra mile and in doing so one doctor saved my life. They are always sympathetic and listen, I never feel rushed. They discuss possible courses of treatments with me and their likely outcomes. I always leave the surgery with confidence that I have been very well looked after. My wife and I refuse to move out of the Hadleigh catchment area because we both feel we wouldn’t find a doctors surgery anywhere near as good as The Hadleigh Practice. I can’t fault The Hadleigh Practice and consider myself very lucky to be their patient. Thank you The Hadleigh Practice.

title: Great flu service
body: The staff were Very friendly and the service was very well organised, quick, prompt and a professional service. If only all appointments ran like this.
